meta.name: Transform Meeting Notes into Asana Tasks & Slack Summaries with GPT-4o

name: AI Meeting Notes to Asana Tasks & Slack Summary

values.placeholder: Who the meeting was with / What it was about

values.fieldLabel: Paste in your meeting notes here
values.placeholder: AI Notetaker Summary, manual notes, shared document

parameters.formDescription:
Transform meeting notes into organized tasks and team summaries.

‚úì Extract key decisions and action items
‚úì Create Asana tasks with due dates
‚úì Send Slack summary to team

Works with AI notetaker transcripts, manual notes, or shared documents.

values.content: You are a helpful, intelligent personal assistant. You extract structured data from meeting notes.

=Extract the following from these meeting notes:

Meeting notes:
{{ $json["Paste in your meeting notes here"] }}

Return a JSON object with these exact keys:
{
  "key_decisions": ["decision 1", "decision 2"],
  "action_items": [
    {
      "task": "task description",
      "assignee": "person name or 'Unassigned'",
      "due_date": "YYYY-MM-DD or null"
    }
  ],
  "next_meeting_date": "YYYY-MM-DD or null",
  "pain_points": ["pain point 1", "pain point 2"],
  "budget_mentioned": "dollar amount or null"
}

Rules:
- If no action items found, return empty array
- If no assignee mentioned, use "Unassigned"
- If no due date mentioned, use null
- Extract dates in YYYY-MM-DD format

parameters.content:
## üìù Meeting Notes to Action Items

**Stop manually tracking action items from meetings.**

This workflow:
- Uses AI to extract key info
- Creates Asana tasks automatically
- Sends team summary via Slack

**Works with any notes format:**
- AI notetaker transcripts
- Manual typed notes
- Shared documents

## Step 1: Submit Notes

Form collects:
- Company/Project name
- Meeting notes
- Asana project
- Slack channel

Tip: Replace with email trigger for automation

## Step 2: AI Extraction

GPT-4o extracts:
- ‚úÖ Decisions
- üìã Action items
- üìÖ Due dates
- ‚ö†Ô∏è Pain points
- üí∞ Budget
- üóìÔ∏è Next meeting

## Step 3: Create Tasks

Each action item becomes a task with:
- Title & assignee
- Due date
- Full meeting context

## Step 4: Slack Summary

Formatted message with:
- Key decisions
- Clickable task links
- Pain points
- Budget & next meeting

Team stays aligned!
